alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, Garland, western Saline, central Hot Spring and west central Pulaski Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 908 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lofton, or 15 miles southwest of Hot Springs, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Village... Malvern... Mountain Pine... Rockport... Amity... Perla... Lonsdale... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Meyers... Lake Ouachita State Park... Lofton... Rockwell... Hot Springs National Park... Jessieville... Bismarck... Magnet Cove... Oaklawn Racetrack... Bonnerdale... Sunshine... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pulaski; Saline
